definition: muscle/tendon/veins visible under the skin/sth resembling tendons or veins (e.g. fiber in a vegetable)
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains

sentences.english: His mind reached after an understanding of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 他开动脑筋，想弄懂这个问题。

sentences.english: It's not just the brainteasers that will stump you.
sentences.chinese: 这不仅仅是能难住你的脑筋急转弯。

sentences.english: It is easy for the mind to ossify .
For years visas have been a neuralgic issue in the region.
sentences.chinese: 多年来，签证问题一直让该地区大伤脑筋。

sentences.english: We should always use our brains and think everything over carefully.
sentences.chinese: 凡事应该用脑筋好好想一想。

sentences.english: Freshman year at college is a very exciting but nerve-wracking experience.
sentences.chinese: 大学第一年令人兴奋，同时也令人伤脑筋。

sentences.english: This problem had nagged the consciousness of foreign aid people for some time.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题已经使援外人员颇伤了一个时期的脑筋。

sentences.english: I see what you are up to.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你在动什么歪脑筋。

sentences.english: A Mob's a Monster; Heads enough, but no Brains.
sentences.chinese: 一群乌合之众就像一个怪物，头长得很多就是没脑筋。

sentences.english: So I need to do something intelligent to exercise my brain.
sentences.chinese: 所以我得做点开动脑筋的事情让大脑也得到锻炼。

sentences.english: That's the worst part -- making decisions.

sentences.chinese: 开动脑筋，为剧本想些点子。

sentences.english: How she should handle this matter troubled her greatly .
sentences.chinese: 她该怎样处理这件事使她大伤脑筋。

sentences.english: Solve your urgent problems with a little creativity.
sentences.chinese: 所以在解决紧急问题时动动脑筋。

sentences.english: In to fill his stomach problem, is that Buha by a headache.
sentences.chinese: 在填饱肚子的问题上，更是令布哈依伤透了脑筋。

sentences.english: They are puzzling through the new rules of the game.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在对新比赛规则大伤脑筋。

definition: to figure out/to work out (a solution etc)/to think up/to come up with (an idea etc)
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
hand and foot/movement of limbs/action/trick/step in a procedure (CL: 道[dao4])
to ponder/to mull over/to think through/Taiwan pr. [zhuo2 mo2]
to carve and polish (jade)/to polish and refine a literary work
